newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK govt paper prices down on U.S. bonds slide.
newsitem.headline: HK govt paper prices down on U.S. bonds slide.

text.p: Hong Kong's long-dated government paper eased on Wednesday after the U.S. Treasuries retreated last night, dealers said.
"Most of the players are sidelinde ahead of the U.S. inflation indicators due later this week, leaving the hedge funds to dominate trade," a dealer at an European bank said.
The seven-year Exchange Fund note yielded 7.80 percent versus 7.76 on Tuesday, five-year yielded 7.41 against 7.38 and three-year 6.83 versus 6.79.
The one week bill yield fell in line with interbank overnight rate to 5.03 percent against 5.07.
The U.S. will release its August producer price and consumer price indices on Thursday and Friday, respectively.
In the interbank market, trading was quiet with some investors covering their short-term money positions.
Overnight rates eased to 5-1/4 1/8 percent against 5-5/16 3/16 but three month was unchanged at 5-11/16 9/16 percent.

Dealers said short-dated money remained tight as the heavily over-subscribed initial public offering of shares in casual wear maker Glorious Sun Enterprises Ltd locked up a hefty amount of money in the banking system.
